reasoning: Metastatic (stage IV) lobular breast carcinoma represents advanced disease. Global breast cancer incidence ~50 per 100k. Invasive lobular carcinoma (ILC) accounts for ~10-15% of invasive breast cancers (~5-7.5 per 100k). Metastatic disease at diagnosis represents ~4-5% of breast cancers (~2.5 per 100k). Estimated metastatic ILC incidence ~8.5 per 100k accounting for higher propensity for late detection.
source: Parkin DM et al. (2005). Global cancer statistics, 2002. CA Cancer J Clin. 55(2):74-108
